greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Irregular triangle by rows, M*Q. M = triangle with (1,2,3,...) in every column, with the leftmost column shifted upwards one row. Q = a diagonalized variant of odd-indexed Fibonacci numbers.
comment: Row sums = the odd-indexed Fibonacci numbers, A001519, starting with offset 1.
For rows > 1, sum of n-th row terms = rightmost term of next row.
formula: Triangle, M*Q; where M = a triangle with (1,2,3,...) in every column with the leftmost column shifted upwards one row. Q = an infinite matrix with the odd-indexed Fibonacci numbers as the right border: (1, 2, 5, 13,...) and
example: First few rows of the triangle:
results.author: _Gary W. Adamson_, Jul 28 2010
